name: VaultWarden
short_desc: Unofficial Bitwarden compatible server written in Rust, formerly known as bitwarden_rs
author: Daniel Garc√≠a
description: An alternative server implementation of the Bitwarden Client API, written in Rust and compatible with official Bitwarden clients, perfect for self-hosted deployment where running the official resource-heavy service might not be ideal.

form_fields.label: Admin Token (Argon2 PCH string)
form_fields.hint: echo -n "MySecretPassword" | argon2 "$(openssl rand -base64 32)" -e -id -k 65540 -t 3 -p 4 #escape all the dollar signs `$` with an extra dollar sign like `$$`

form_fields.label: Signups allowed
form_fields.hint: Controls if new users can register

form_fields.label: Invitations allowed
form_fields.hint: Invitations org admins to invite users, even when signups are disabled

form_fields.label: Disbale admin token
form_fields.hint: Enable this to bypass the admin panel security. This option is only meant to be used with the use of a separate auth layer in front.

form_fields.label: Show password hint
form_fields.hint: Controls whether a password hint should be shown directly in the web page if SMTP service is not configured.

form_fields.label: Password iterations
form_fields.hint: Number of server-side passwords hashing iterations for the password hash.

form_fields.label: SMTP host
form_fields.hint: Set SMTP host and SMTP from to enable the mail service.

form_fields.label: SMTP from
form_fields.hint: Set SMTP host and SMTP from to enable the mail service.

form_fields.label: SMTP port
form_fields.hint: Ports 587 (submission) and 25 (smtp) are standard without encryption and with encryption via STARTTLS (Explicit TLS). Port 465 (submissions) is used for encrypted submission (Implicit TLS).

form_fields.label: SMTP security
form_fields.hint: ("starttls", "force_tls", "off") Enable a secure connection. Default is "starttls" (Explicit - ports 587 or 25), "force_tls" (Implicit - port 465) or "off", no encryption (port 25)
